references.paper_title: Truenorth: Design and tool flow of a 65 mw 1 million neuron programmable neurosynaptic chip
references.reason: This paper is foundational for the field by introducing the Truenorth neurosynaptic chip, demonstrating the feasibility of large-scale SNN hardware implementations.

references.paper_title: Long short-term memory and learning-to-learn in networks of spiking neurons
references.reason: This work significantly advanced SNN training by demonstrating the capacity of spiking neural networks to perform tasks associated with recurrent neural networks.

references.paper_title: Error-backpropagation in networks of fractionally predictive spiking neurons
references.reason: This paper is highly influential as one of the first to introduce a method for training SNNs using backpropagation, a critical step in enabling more sophisticated learning in SNNs.

references.paper_title: Unsupervised learning of digit recognition using spike-timing-dependent plasticity
references.reason: This paper is highly cited due to its demonstration that unsupervised learning is applicable for training spiking neural networks, which is notable for its biological plausibility.

references.paper_title: Superspike: Supervised learning in multilayer spiking neural networks
references.reason: This work addresses a core challenge in SNN research by proposing a method for supervised learning in multilayer spiking neural networks which improves the accuracy of the learned models.
